data.title: Edward H McMasters (1751-1833)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Edward McMasters born 1751 Dublin, Ireland died 1833 Lycoming Township, Lycoming, Pennsylvania, United States including father + descendants + 1 genealogist comments + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
[sibling(s) unknown]

Descendants

Profile last modified 6 Jun 2023 | Created 14 Apr 2015

This page has been accessed 547 times.

Contents

1 Biography

2 Research Notes

3 Sources

4 Acknowledgements

Biography

Edward McMasters served with 1st Pennsylvania Regiment, Continental Army during the American Revolution.

Edward McMasters was born in 1751 in Dublin, Ireland, the only child of Richard.

He married Rhoda Fairchild on March 16, 1777, in Burlington, New Jersey.

Children:

Hannah McMasters 1774 – 1864,

Ebenezer McMasters 1778 – 1873

John McMasters 1780 – 1819

Jane McMasters 1782 – 1854

Richard McMasters 1788 – 1789

Mary McMasters 1790 – 1885

Sarah McMasters 1793 – 1793

William George McMasters 1794 – 1866

Robert McMasters 1796 – 1866

In 1800, Edward Masters lived in Pine Creek, Pennsylvania. In 1810, Edward Masters lived in Mifflin, Pennsylvania. In 1818 U.S., Revolutionary War Pension and Bounty-Land Warrant Application Files, 1800-1900.

He died on April 22, 1833, in Lycoming, Pennsylvania, having lived a long life of 82 years, and was buried in Tombs Run, Pennsylvania.

Born 1751 Trenton, Burlington, New Jersey. [1][2][3][4][5][6]

Died Age: 82. 22 Apr 1833. Lycoming, Lycoming, Pennsylvania, USA. [7][8][9][10][11]

Buried Tombs Run, Lycoming County, Pennsylvania, USA. [12][13][14]

1810 Mifflin, Lycoming, Pennsylvania, United States. [15] 1830 Brown, Lycoming, Pennsylvania, United States. [16] 1800 Pine Creek, Lycoming, Pennsylvania, United States. Pennsylvania, United States. 1820 Lycoming, Pennsylvania, United States. [17] 1835 Pennsylvania[18] 1832 Northampton, Bucks, Pennsylvania, United States. [19]

Military Service: Pennsylvania Service: Revolutionary War. July 1, 1775. PA Prisoner on the Jersey as per the DAR patriot record. [20]

Death: Apr. 22, 1833 Lycoming County. Pennsylvania, USA. Pennsylvania, Revolutionary War Battalions and Militia Index, 1775-1783.

Research Notes

I ran across a Edward McMasters who sighed a petition for two new townships in 1785 the first to be called Lycoming and the second Pine creek,38 people signed this petition. The petition was sent to the Justices of the Quarter Sessions to be held at Sunbury, Northumberland County, Pa. Aug 1785. I copied the petition while at Sunbury a couple of years ago. The County of Lycoming was formed after the Township of Lycoming. Some of the folks on the petition had settled prior to 1785 and where forced to flee during the revolution due to the Indian raids. there is quite a bit of History on this, it was called the Great Runaway. Many settlers killed and most fleeing to fort Augusta, the Indians having sided with the British. Two of my possible ancestors James Alexander and Joseph Alexander also signed the petition, Chris Alexander. - Earl Pendleton. 2 Inscription: 1st PA Regt. Cont. Line. 2 Note: Revolutionary War marker Burial: Tombs Run Cemetery. Tombs Run. Lycoming County. Pennsylvania, USA. Find A Grave Memorial# 42606514. https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/42606514/edward-mcmasters Created by: Rodger. Record added: Oct 01, 2009.

Marriage Husband Edward H McMasters. Wife @P329@. Child: Ebenezer McMasters. Child: John McMasters. Child: Jane McMasters. Child: Richard McMasters. Child: Mary McMasters. Child: Sarah McMasters. Child: William George McMasters. Child: Robert McMasters 1796 – 1866. McMasters. Marriage March 16, 1777. Morristown, Morris, New Jersey.
